result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:16 AM Defendant BRYAN ALLEN SHAW appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for BRYAN ALLEN SHAW.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer received. Involves PSI. Counter offer discussed. No resolution. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
(Jail/5053)

10:16 AM Defendant BRYAN ALLEN SHAW appeared by video, at treatment.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for BRYAN ALLEN SHAW.  Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint filed today and Offer received. To review new filings. Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

to Amend to Signature Bond for treatment

10:27 AM   Defendant BRYAN ALLEN SHAW appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for BRYAN ALLEN SHAW. Attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Yohnk informs the Court the defendant has been accepted into Farhman Center but there is not date of entry as of today. Objects to bond modification. 
Attorney Hillestad requests to modify bond to allow defendant to enter into Farhman without having an additional bond hearing. 
Court grants request.
Bail/bond hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant wishes to address bond due to his pending residential treatment as per ATR agreement. 
ADA Matthews requests to schedule a bond hearing outside of intake. 
Court grants request. 
Defendant to provide confirmation of ATR agreement to Attorney Hillestad.
